Module downfall
Package net.dragondelve.ui.main

Class DownfallMainController

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.dragondelve.downfall.ui.main.DownfallMainController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    StageController
    public class DownfallMainController
extends java.lang.Object
implements StageController
    Controller for the main GUI of Downfall EAM. Controls /fxml/main/DownfallMain.fxml and is annotated with @FXML where it references that FXML file.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Initialize method that is called automatically after the FXML has finished loading. Initializes all UI elements before they are displayed

      • setStage

        public void setStage​(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
        Lightweight Mutator Method. Always should be called before the stage is displayed to the user.
        Specified by:
        setStage in interface StageController
        Parameters:
        stage - Stage on which this controller is displayed.

      • openEditor

        private void openEditor​(java.net.URL editorFXMLURL,
                        StageController controller,
                        java.lang.String title)
        Creates a stage on which an editor controlled by a StageController can be displayed. Loads an FXML File from the URL, sets the controller and finally displays the stage.
        Parameters:
        editorFXMLURL - URL to a FXML file that contains the editor's gui information.
        controller - controller to be used for the new Stage.
        title - text title to be displayed on the new Stage.

      • exportRules

        private void exportRules()
        Exports current ruleset to an XML File at a destination selected by a user with a JavaFX FileChooser. Saves the new destination as lastLoadedRules in the Configuration.

      • importRules

        private void importRules()
        Imports and applies a ruleset from an XML File at a destination selected by a user with a JavaFX FileChooser. Saves the new destination as lastLoadedRules in the Configuration

      • initializeRealmTab

        private void initializeRealmTab()
        loads the content of RealmScreen.fxml and puts its root node into the "Realm" tab.

        Initializes all Tabs with their respective content.
